intro: Cleistanthus johnsonii var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy cleistanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage, which give it its common name. It typically grows in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
